Suitable animal models for evaluating vaccines for SARS- and MERS-CoV are lacking or highly limited, making the process of vaccine development highly challenging.
42, 43 Development of an efficient animal model that mimics the clinical disease can inform on pathogenesis as well as to develop vaccines and therapeutics against these CoVs. Several animal models have been evaluated for SARS- and MERS CoVs including mouse, guinea pigs, hamsters, ferrets, rabbits, rhesus macaques, marmosets, and cats.
